intro: Calusparassus forsteri, commonly known as the Forster's spurge, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It produces a latex-like substance that can be irritating to the skin. Due to its habitat and appearance, it is often found in shaded, humid environments.
